DataElement.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Specimen Consent Version Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified for version as related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of  tissue or blood or urine samples for correlative study use.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of  tissue or blood or urine samples for correlative study use.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools.  Includes marker research.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified for version.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
